conclusion: Line a is the relationship image of the terminal voltage U and current I of the battery under a certain light intensity, and line b is the U-I image of a resistance R.
Identify the relationships between voltage and current for the battery and the resistance from the image.
Use the provided equations to calculate the internal resistance of the battery based on the given conditions.

The image displays two lines, labeled as a and b. Line a represents the relationship between voltage U and current I for a battery under certain light intensity conditions. Line b depicts the relationship for a resistance R. The axes are labeled with U/V on the vertical axis and I/A on the horizontal axis.
Line a shows the voltage-current relationship for the battery under specific light conditions, described by the equation U = U_0 - RI_0.
Line b represents a pure resistance R where the voltage is directly proportional to the current: U = RI.
The internal resistance r of the battery is found by comparing these two conditions at the intersection point of line a and line b.
Calculate the internal resistance r using the equation r = (U_0 - U) / I at the intersection point.
Substitute the values from the intersection point into the equation to find the internal resistance r.
By solving the equations and substituting the known values, the internal resistance r is found to be 3.
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell when they are formed into a closed loop at this light intensity is 3.
